result.execSummary:
The defendant Ted M Britton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Make False/Forged Prescription Order, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $379.00 - 7 DTP.  3 days in RCJ for contempt if not paid.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ted M Britton

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

Defendant Ted M Britton in court with attorney James E Goldmann.  Brian Van Schyndel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Elizabeth Kiel.  State rec:  100+cc.
COP filed.
P - G
BTC:  Guilty
100+cc

FTP:  3 days
Status conference on May 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on April 23, 2015 at 03:15 pm.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  You have been ordered to have your fingerprints/photographs taken as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Department Records Bureau. Hours:  Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:00 a.m. or between 1:00 p.m. and 3:00 p.m.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Ted M Britton in court with attorney James E Goldmann.  Thomas Jerome Coaty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 03:15 pm.  Status conference scheduled for May 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
